a2sIpAddress.title: a2sIpAddress
a2sIpAddress.description: -a2sIpAddress sets Steam Query Protocol's Bind IP address.
a2sIpAddress.htmlDescription: -a2sIpAddress sets Steam Query Protocol's Bind IP address.

a2sPort.title: a2sPort
a2sPort.description: -a2sPort sets Steam Query Protocol's Bind port.
a2sPort.htmlDescription: -a2sPort sets Steam Query Protocol's Bind port.

autoreload.title: autoreload
autoreload.description: -autoreload reloads the scenario when the session ends after the provided delay, without shutting down the server. Value is in seconds.
autoreload.htmlDescription: -autoreload reloads the scenario when the session ends after the provided delay, without shutting down the server. Value is in seconds.

bindIP.title: bindIP
bindIP.description: -bindIP can be used to override both gameHostBindAddress and gameHostRegisterBindAddress values present in server config.
bindIP.htmlDescription: -bindIP can be used to override both gameHostBindAddress and gameHostRegisterBindAddress values present in server config.

bindPort.title: bindPort
bindPort.description: -bindPort can be used to override both gameHostBindPort and gameHostRegisterBindPort values present in server config.
bindPort.htmlDescription: -bindPort can be used to override both gameHostBindPort and gameHostRegisterBindPort values present in server config.

config.title: config
config.description: -config is used by servers to point to a JSON server configuration.
config.htmlDescription: -config is used by servers to point to a JSON server configuration.

listScenarios.title: listScenarios
listScenarios.description: -listScenarios prints to game logs the scenario .conf file paths.
listScenarios.htmlDescription: -listScenarios prints to game logs the scenario .conf file paths.

logStats.title: logStats
logStats.description: -logStats allows to log performance statistics every (optionally) defined interval (in milliseconds).
logStats.htmlDescription: -logStats allows to log performance statistics every (optionally) defined interval (in milliseconds).

maxFPS.title: maxFPS
maxFPS.description: -maxFPS sets max FPS limit - useful for a server, or to force a client's max FPS.
maxFPS.htmlDescription: -maxFPS sets max FPS limit - useful for a server, or to force a client's max FPS.

client.title: client
client.description: -client starts up an RplSession in local client mode. The session tries to connect to the provided IP.
client.htmlDescription: -client starts up an RplSession in local client mode. The session tries to connect to the provided IP.

nds.title: nds
nds.description: -nds Network Dynamic Simulation (nds) is a server feature that only streams in relevant replicated entities for each client. the provided value stands for diameter, or the number of cells which are being replicated - default is 2 in each direction. To turn the feature off use -nds 0. A higher diameter will result in a bigger networked view range, lower server performance.
nds.htmlDescription: -nds Network Dynamic Simulation (nds) is a server feature that only streams in relevant replicated entities for each client. the provided value stands for diameter, or the number of cells which are being replicated - default is 2 in each direction. To turn the feature off use -nds 0. A higher diameter will result in a bigger networked view range, lower server performance.

nwkResolution.title: nwkResolution
nwkResolution.description: -nwkResolution defines what resolution Spatial Map cells should be set at in a 100..1000m range. Smaller resolution will result in less 'pop-in' but lower networked view range. For high view range use high resolution, but small diameter.
nwkResolution.htmlDescription: -nwkResolution defines what resolution Spatial Map cells should be set at in a 100..1000m range. Smaller resolution will result in less 'pop-in' but lower networked view range. For high view range use high resolution, but small diameter.

rpl-reconnect.title: rpl-reconnect
rpl-reconnect.description: -rpl-reconnect makes the replication try to reconnect instead of immediately raising connection failure.
rpl-reconnect.htmlDescription: -rpl-reconnect makes the replication try to reconnect instead of immediately raising connection failure.

rpl-timeout-ms.title: rpl-timeout-ms
rpl-timeout-ms.description: -rpl-timeout-ms sets the client/server timeout's value, in milliseconds.
rpl-timeout-ms.htmlDescription: -rpl-timeout-ms sets the client/server timeout's value, in milliseconds.

rpl-validation-rdb-disable.title: rpl-validation-rdb-disable
rpl-validation-rdb-disable.description: -rpl-validation-rdb-disable disables the validation of clients resource database. This should not be disabled in normal usage conditions. This is for development purpose only!
rpl-validation-rdb-disable.htmlDescription: -rpl-validation-rdb-disable disables the validation of clients resource database. This should not be disabled in normal usage conditions. This is for development purpose only!

rpl-validation-scr-disable.title: rpl-validation-scr-disable
rpl-validation-scr-disable.description: Disables the validation of clients scripts checksum. This should not be disabled in normal usage conditions. This is for development purpose only!
rpl-validation-scr-disable.htmlDescription: Disables the validation of clients scripts checksum. <warning>This should not be disabled in normal usage conditions. This is for development purpose only!</warning>

rpl-validation-version-disable.title: rpl-validation-version-disable
rpl-validation-version-disable.description: Disables the validation of clients executable version. This should not be disabled in normal usage conditions. This is for development purpose only!
rpl-validation-version-disable.htmlDescription: Disables the validation of clients executable version. <warning>This should not be disabled in normal usage conditions. This is for development purpose only!</warning>

staggeringBudget.title: staggeringBudget
staggeringBudget.description: -staggeringBudget defines how many stationary spatial map cells are allowed to be processed in one tick in 1..10201 range. If not set it uses '-nds' diameter. A lower number will limit how many cells the server has to process per tick, but increase the time it takes for a client to have all relevant entities streamed in, if the server experiences significant performance drops on spawning/teleporting then the number is set too high, if you the client experiences 'pop-in' of replicated items then the number is set too low.
staggeringBudget.htmlDescription: -staggeringBudget defines how many stationary spatial map cells are allowed to be processed in one tick in 1..10201 range. If not set it uses '-nds' diameter. A lower number will limit how many cells the server has to process per tick, but increase the time it takes for a client to have all relevant entities streamed in, if the server experiences significant performance drops on spawning/teleporting then the number is set too high, if you the client experiences 'pop-in' of replicated items then the number is set too low.

streamingBudget.title: streamingBudget
streamingBudget.description: -streamingBudget is the global streaming budget that is equally distributed between all connections. To decrement the budget, it uses the replicated hierarchy size of each entity that needs to be streamed in. It cannot go under 100 to prevent the system stalling. A lower number will limit how many entities the server has to process per tick, but increase the time it takes for a client to have that entity streamed in, if the server experiences significant performance drops on spawning/teleporting then the number is set too high, if the client experiences 'pop-in' of replicated items then the number is set too low.
streamingBudget.htmlDescription: -streamingBudget is the global streaming budget that is equally distributed between all connections. To decrement the budget, it uses the replicated hierarchy size of each entity that needs to be streamed in. It cannot go under 100 to prevent the system stalling. A lower number will limit how many entities the server has to process per tick, but increase the time it takes for a client to have that entity streamed in, if the server experiences significant performance drops on spawning/teleporting then the number is set too high, if the client experiences 'pop-in' of replicated items then the number is set too low.

streamsDelta.title: streamsDelta
streamsDelta.description: -streamsDelta is a tool to limit the amount of streams being opened for a client in range 1..1000 (default 100). If the difference between 'the number of streams the server has open' and 'the number of streams the client has open' is larger than the NUMBER then the server will not open any more streams this tick. To be adjusted based on average client networking speed.
streamsDelta.htmlDescription: -streamsDelta is a tool to limit the amount of streams being opened for a client in range 1..1000 (default 100). If the difference between 'the number of streams the server has open' and 'the number of streams the client has open' is larger than the NUMBER then the server will not open any more streams this tick. To be adjusted based on average client networking speed.

aiLimit.title: aiLimit
aiLimit.description: -aiLimit sets the top limit of AIs. No systems will be able to spawn any AIs when this ceiling is reached (through aiWorld.CanAICharacterBeAdded() - see also SCR_AIGroup and SCR_ChimeraAIAgent).
aiLimit.htmlDescription: -aiLimit sets the top limit of AIs. No systems will be able to spawn any AIs when this ceiling is reached (through aiWorld.CanAICharacterBeAdded() - see also SCR_AIGroup and SCR_ChimeraAIAgent).

debugger.title: debugger
debugger.description: -debugger sets the script debugger to a specific address.
debugger.htmlDescription: -debugger sets the script debugger to a specific address.

debuggerPort.title: debuggerPort
debuggerPort.description: -debuggerPort sets the script debugger to a specific port.
debuggerPort.htmlDescription: -debuggerPort sets the script debugger to a specific port.

disableCrashReporter.title: disableCrashReporter
disableCrashReporter.description: Disable Crash Reporter from appearing/sending reports automatically.

keepNumOfLogs.title: keepNumOfLogs
keepNumOfLogs.description: -keepNumOfLogs sets the maximum amount of logs to keep (default: 10).
keepNumOfLogs.htmlDescription: -keepNumOfLogs sets the maximum amount of logs to keep (default: 10).

log-rdb-checksum.title: log-rdb-checksum
log-rdb-checksum.description: -log-rdb-checksum enables logging detailed information about RDB checksum computation (GUID and path in order in which they are added to checksum) for RDB checksum issues debugging.
log-rdb-checksum.htmlDescription: -log-rdb-checksum enables logging detailed information about RDB checksum computation (GUID and path in order in which they are added to checksum) for RDB checksum issues debugging.

log-scr-checksum.title: log-scr-checksum
log-scr-checksum.description: -log-scr-checksum enables the logging of all script files used in compilation and their checksums.
log-scr-checksum.htmlDescription: -log-scr-checksum enables the logging of all script files used in compilation and their checksums.

logAppend.title: logAppend
logAppend.description: -logAppend makes logs to not be emptied on game start, keeping the history.
logAppend.htmlDescription: -logAppend makes logs to not be emptied on game start, keeping the history.

logFS.title: logFS
logFS.description: -logFS logs every F'ile System's read/write operation in filesystem.log. This option is very demanding and can produce a big file in a short time, so it is to use with caution for debug purpose.
logFS.htmlDescription: -logFS logs every File System's read/write operation in filesystem.log. This option is very demanding and can produce a big file in a short time, so it is to use with caution for debug purpose.
